criteria.label: Professional skills
criteria.questionHint: Expert in a technology domain (Java/.NET/iOS/etc.), makes architectural decisions and suggests solutions. Writes exemplary code. Demonstrates industry best practices.

criteria.label: Quality of work
criteria.questionHint: Consistently writes top-quality code without side effects. Refactors code as necessary. Code quality makes it easy for others to do their jobs.

criteria.label: Effectiveness
criteria.questionHint: Shows a speed of work that is faster than the team's average. Drives quality checks.

criteria.label: Problem solving skills
criteria.questionHint: Ability to work through details of a problem to reach a solution.

fields.hint:
Approaches all problems with confidence and the dedication to generate solid and innovative solutions.
Consistently comes up with outstanding solutions to the most demanding problems.

Comes up with creative strategies when other employees are stuck.
Takes a fresh look at problems and identifies new ways to solve them.
Able to come up with multiple last-minute solutions.

Gets insight into tasks quickly, proposes directions to solve issues.
Able to change the strategy when unable to move forward.
Can be dropped into a new and unfamiliar task type.
Can effectively ask questions when needed. Delivers working solutions.

Identifies problems, but sometimes takes inadequate steps to resolve them. Prefers choosing known task types if possible.
Gets confused in unexpected situations.
Does not ask questions when appropriate, trying to solve everything alone.

In most cases, comes up with solutions that are incorrect, insufficient, and invalid.
Fails to apply lessons learned from similar cases.
Gives up upon encountering the first blocking issue.
Analyzes minor issues and lets larger problems grow.

criteria.label: Reliability
criteria.questionHint: Provides reasonable estimations for implementing applications/frameworks and can deliver quality on time.

criteria.label: Attitude & Dedication
criteria.questionHint: Ambition, approach to tasks, showing interest in work, motivation, helpfulness, teamwork, initiative, asking for support if blocked, adequate escalation.

fields.hint: Able to motivate others, find interesting problems in the work, seeks a challenge, diligent, role model, happy to help others.
Positive effect on people around, likes the job, strives to reach the next level.
Acts professionally, only minor problems and issues, reasonable most of the time. Observes company policies. Ambitious and helpful.
Sometimes negative, not motivated. Tired of problems and the client, which is visible for others. Sometimes does not ask for help / does not invest effort before asking.
Negative, not motivated, destroys others' good spirit, bad team member, lazy. Does not realize when to ask for help.

criteria.label: Communication skills
criteria.questionHint: Written and verbal communication, especially on team meetings. Includes interaction with team members and the customer.

fields.hint: Can lead discussions; clear, brief, and to-the-point e-mails; effective verbal communication.
Effective discussions and e-mail threads, able to promptly clarify complex issues.

Able to describe things in a way people can understand. Able to express short and concise opinions.
Can effectively participate in discussions.
Sometimes unclear or ambiguous text in e-mails, misunderstanding other people's words.
Major written and verbal communication problems. May avoid public speaking or keep silence on the meetings even when has ideas to share. Not supposed to communicate with the client.

criteria.label: Contribution
criteria.questionHint: Valuable effort contributed to the company and the customer.

fields.hint: Initiates and actively participates in different kinds of project and non-project activities beyond main responsibilities, bringing additional value and expertise without negative impact on regular duties.
Supports initiatives and optional activities, sometimes taking extra effort for company and/or customer improvements.
Works with full load on regular activities, accepts tasks and resolves them in a timely manner, contributes to the team according to the main responsibilities.
Not willing to participate in initiatives even if current workload allows it, doesn’t demonstrate interest in process improvements.
Workload is often below average, underutilization without appropriate notification. Rejects to participate in improvement programs even if it is required by main responsibilities.

criteria.label: Self development
criteria.questionHint:
Coaches one person.
Presents one training quarterly.
Technical interviewer.
Gives support in expert areas.
Tries out new technologies on internal projects, reads blogs/books, watches training videos.

fields.hint: Close to native speaker level.

Well-written e-mails, informal discussions, good vocabulary, fluent verbal communication.
Can easily write documents from scratch.
Decent written and verbal communication, doesn't require correction.
Sometimes problematic English, but able to communicate in general. Able to read/write e-mails, follow discussions.

Spelling and grammatical errors in writing.
Cannot speak during daily stand-up meetings.
Major problems with verbal communication.

criteria.label: Leadership
criteria.questionHint:
Can be a Scrum master or technical leader.
Works effectively with Senior Managers and Project Managers, understands business constraints and priorities. Gives and collects realistic team and project status. Takes on more complicated tasks, drives technical execution of the project.

criteria.label: Work w/ him/her in next project?
criteria.questionHint: Would you be happy to work with him/her again on your next project or team?

fields.hint: Absolutely. She/he is exceptionally good to work with, we are very efficient together.
I'd be happy to work with her/him again on my next project.
I'm neutral, no good or bad feelings towards the person. We could work again.
If possible, no, we are not an ideal combination. We can work together, but usually have some issues – see the Textual summary field.
Definitely not, I have major concerns about this person so I'd like to avoid being on the same team. For reasons see the Textual summary field.

criteria.label: Overall evaluation
criteria.questionHint: Expert in several fields, supports others, respected by the team. Can technically lead a team, can design components and processes. Can establish a good client relationship. A good communicator and code reviewer.
